Package harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

Class TAward

  • java.lang.Object
    • harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TAward
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class TAward
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A TAward object has a value (AMBO = two number in a row, TERNO = three number in a row, ... up to TOMBOLA 15 numbers matched on a card) and represent a prize cards can win playing the game. TAward objects should be prepared before a game starts and collected in a TAwardList object, where they must be arranged in ascending order to let TGame methods work properly.
    Since:
    1.8
    See Also:
    TAwardList, TGame, Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  TAward.TAwardStatus
      Possible award statuses used by TGame methods while checking is one or more cards have won an award following each number extraction.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int AMBO
      A card wins the AMBO if it is the first card on the game to match 2 numbers on the same a row.
      static int QUATERNA
      A card wins the QUATERNA if it is the first card on the game to match 4 numbers on the same a row.
      static int QUINTINA
      A card wins the QUINTINA if it is the first card on the game to match all the 5 numbers on a row.
      static int TERNO
      A card wins the TERNO if it is the first card on the game to match 3 numbers on the same a row.
      static int TOMBOLA
      A card wins the TOMBOLA if it is the first card on the game to match all the 15 numbers on the card.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TAward

        public TAward​(java.lang.String name,
              int value)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Instantiate an award for a game. You have just to name it and associate a value to it.
        Parameters:
        name - The symbolic name identifying the award (you can use "AMBO", "TERNO", etc.).
        value - The integral score associated to each prize (2 = AMBO, 3 = TERNO, ..., 15 = TOMBOLA). Valid values are within the [2,15] range.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getWinnerList

        public java.util.List<TCard> getWinnerList()
        To properly manage winners during a tombola game, to each award is associated a list of cards that, as the game progresses, will maintain references to the card or the cards winning the award. And... yes, the list is needed because more than "a single card" can be associated to an award. In Italy, if two players hit a prize (say TERNO) after the extraction of the same number, usually they can decide to divide (that is, "spartimm") the prize.
        Returns:
        the list of card(s) considered winner(s) of this prize
        See Also:
        TGame.resolveCandidates(int)

      • getCandidatesList

        public java.util.List<TCard> getCandidatesList()
        Helping list used to maintain cards hitting the score for the award while checking all the playing cards within a game (@linkplain TGame}. When all cards have been checked after a number extraction, the candidateList is been used by invoking the TGame.resolveCandidates(int) method to choose one or more final winner for the award.
        Returns:
        the current list of cards candidate to be assigned the award.
        See Also:
        TGame, TGame.extractNumber(int)

      • getWithJollyList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Boolean> getWithJollyList()
        If a card wins this award using also its Jolly Number, that is is put also in this list.
        Returns:
        the list containing all the cards that have been assigned this award AND have won it using also their Jolly number.

      • isAvailable

        public boolean isAvailable()
        Helping method, return true if the award is still AVAILABLE to be won by a card
        Returns:
        true if the award is still AVAILABLE to be won by a card

      • isAssigned

        public boolean isAssigned()
        Helping method, return true if the award has already been won by a card
        Returns:
        true if the award has already been won by a card

      • isContended

        public boolean isContended()
        Helping method, return true if the award actually is contended by two or more cards hitting needed score after the extraction of the same number.
        Returns:
        true if the award actually is contended by two or more cards hitting needed score after the same extraction
